Package chess.model.moves

Class Capture

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Colored
chess.model.moves.Movable
chess.model.moves.Movement
chess.model.moves.RegularMove
chess.model.moves.Capture
All Implemented Interfaces:
chess.persistence.Codable
Direct Known Subclasses:
EnPassantCapture
public class Capture extends RegularMove
A concrete object that represents a capture.

A capture is based on a regular move except that an opponent's piece is present at the final position and will be removed from the chessboard upon capture.

In addition to the information captured by a regular move, a capture encodes the following additional information regarding the movement:

  1. The piece to be captured.
A capture can be applied to all concrete subclasses of Piece.

    • Capture

      public Capture(Piece piece, Piece capturedPiece)
      Constructs a capture for a subject piece and the piece to be captured.
      Parameters:
      piece - The target piece of the capture.
      capturedPiece - The piece to be captured by the target piece.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any of the arguments is null.

  • Method Details

    • encode

      public final org.json.JSONObject encode()
      Serializes this capture to a JSON object of the following format: 
       {
     "color":"<color>",
     "initialPosition":"<position>",
     "finalPosition":"<position>",
     "type":"Capture",
     "pieceId":"<id-1>",
     "capturedPieceId":"<id-2>",
     "willCheckOpponent": <true/false>
 }
      where:
      • <id-2>: the Version 4 UUID string of the piece to be captured.
      Specified by:
      encode in interface chess.persistence.Codable
      Overrides:
      encode in class Movement
      Returns:
      A serialized object ready to be written.
      See Also:
      • Movement.encode()

    • execute

      public final int execute(Chessboard chessboard)
      Executes this capture on the given chessboard and increments the move count of the target piece.

      As a result, the piece to be captured is removed from the chessboard and the target piece is moved to the final position.

      Overrides:
      execute in class RegularMove
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which this capture is executed.
      Returns:
      The number of points associated with the captured piece.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with capturedPieceId is found on chessboard.
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • undo

      public final int undo(Chessboard chessboard)
      Undoes this capture on the given chessboard and decrements the move count of the target piece.

      As a result, the target piece is moved back to the initial position of this regular move and the captured piece is added back to the chessboard.

      Overrides:
      undo in class RegularMove
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard on which this capture is undone.
      Returns:
      The number of points associated with the captured piece.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with capturedPieceId is found on chessboard.
      NullPointerException - If chessboard is null.

    • isCheckingOpponent

      public final boolean isCheckingOpponent(Chessboard chessboard)
      This method is used primarily for forward-checking. As a candidate movement, if the piece to be captured is a King, then the move that led to this capture should be considered as an unsafe and illegal move, for no player is allowed to make a move that puts their own King in check.

      The negation of this method is the precondition for execute(Chessboard), since a King will never be captured in a Chess game.

      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard from which the piece to be captured is resolved.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the piece to be captured is a King.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with capturedPieceId is found on chessboard.

    • getCapturedPiece

      public final Piece getCapturedPiece(Chessboard chessboard)
      Parameters:
      chessboard - The chessboard from which the piece to be captured is resolved.
      Returns:
      The piece to be captured by this capture on the given chessboard.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If no piece with capturedPieceId is found on chessboard.

    • getDestinationString

      public final String getDestinationString(Chessboard chessboard)
      Since an opponent's piece will be present at a capture's final position, a capture's destination string is of the form: 
       ♟@[position], e.g. ♟@a2
      This shows not only the final position but also the piece to be captured.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the above-mentioned form.

    • getCapturedPieceId

      public String getCapturedPieceId()
      Returns:
      The Version 4 UUID string of the piece to be captured.
